message: Maybe you don't know me, but I'm famous for being the inventor of the sequential programming
That is the primordial language of the computers!
Well, I didn't have a keyboard or a smartphone like you do but, I did have a 'computer'
I mean, sort of a computer. It was one of the first machines that 'computed'
When I was about your age, I met a mathematician named Charles Babbage
He was working on a machine that could make some LONG math calculations
They've asked me to translate an article about the machine and, in the process, I bacame so curious about it's functioning that I invented an entire new way of 'talking' to the machine
Let me take you back in time about 200 years
This part of the machine is one of the most important. It makes you input the numbers to be calculated
If you move the first gear 10 times, the second will move 1. When the second rotates 10 times, the third will move once, and so on
How many times should I rotate the first gear to get 104 on the machine?
